```
[microbenchmarks] No significant performance differences
```

I've built out the code generator, and made some API tweaks (moving the scheduler type out of the main template argument list).

The approach could be taken further, but I worry it starts to look ridiculous. One could envisage the following API:
```c++
MakeClosure::ForScheduler<SchedulerType>::WithArgs<A,B,C>::ForClass<Foo>::Method<&Foo::Bar>();
```
Given that this has no tests, I'm going to wait until I'm back to write them and let folks stew on this for that time.

Pushed now :)

Feedback has gone quiet here... any thoughts folks?

Sorry for the delay; I'm really swamped at the moment.

I've reviewed this mainly from the perspective of the API; I assume that Vijay will review the implementation.  (I glanced at the implementation, but this is more complex use of templates than I've dealt with in the past, and I don't have the time I'd need to understand it in detail right now.)

Overall, this looks pretty decent.  I'm still not thrilled with the closure API itself (for the same reason I described in my original review), but I understand the need to trade-off API usability with performance.  I guess we'll just have to see how easy it is in practice to have each class define its own helper function for creating closures.

---
